title: I got wrongfully banned by the system
body:
I don't understand Riot's new anti toxicity system (old player), I'm not even saying anything harsh and I am getting two week suspensions.   Can someone please tell me what I'm doing wrong..? I don't want to lose another account, but I am a S1 player that just came back this year and you can't even say one borderline comment without getting banned.. I'm really really scared, I can't play my favorite game anymore at all, if you type or argue with your teammates you get punished.  Any other high level competitive game there is banter, people are a little thick skinned, it's the internet, and I can't say one thing without getting my account banned.


https://justpaste.it/3luyw


This is the ONLY game the automated system gave as "evidence" to warrant a TWO WEEK suspension, I was getting trolled by a Darius that kept running it down mid and was on edge the entire game (how much you want to bet the Darius didn't get punished for inting), but did I say ANYTHING remotely close to deserve ANY kind of punishment let alone TWO WEEKS?

> [{quoted}](name=The Maritimer,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=eB8k5UgV,comment-id=0007000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-09T00:34:54.426+0000)I dare you to get good at any other game (assuming you're good @ this one) and go into voice comms and see how people talk to each other.  You probably wouldn't be able to take 5 minutes.

I've done Mythic raiding in WoW, and led pug raids. I regularly play Overwatch, somewhere in the Platinum area. I've played a *lot* of multiplayer games: some with more toxic communities, some with less toxic communities. So I can indeed put up with a lot. The question is whether or not that makes treating other players that way *okay*, which is, I feel, a different question then whether or not I can take it. I can: I don't actually report many players in *League*, and I *personally* would likely not have bothered to report this. That does not, however, make it okay behavior *given that you have been warned about your behavior before*. If you did not have a history of problematic behavior, this would be a tiny blip on your record, which seems about appropriate. When you show a pattern of problematic behavior, however, you get less leeway for those little blips.

This is not a “new” system. This same system and same rule set has been in place since Tribunal - the only change being the system is now automated instead of waiting for manual Tribunal votes.

You did not say “one” borderline comment - you said multiple things throughout the game that were negative, condescending, and toxic in nature - even if they weren’t flaming.

If you truly think anything I said there was negative or toxic in nature, besides my one comment calling people losers (which I meant to say in a sarcastic tone) and warrants a two week suspension then I truly feel sorry for the people in your life that have to deal with such a weak and thin-skinned individual.  I paid my way through college boosting nerds in S3-4, I play this game for fun now and like to type, but clearly Riot has catered their punishment system to appease gross people like yourself.  Go fuck yourself man.

Most people understand that the internet is and always will be a cesspool of harmless trash talk and mindless drivel and are able to ignore it. Your question was answered. It is a claim backed by common sense and personal observation. The appeal to ignorance fallacy is the notion that "You can't prove it so it is not relevant". You could use the same argument against the statement "The majority of people don't like to be stolen from" which also could not be proven without taking a sample of the world's population but it is common sense.

I would also refute the notion that the board's population is not large enough of a sample size to get a measure of an opinion of the player base. I would further argue that board attracts just as many toxic players as it does non toxic players. While it is possible for Riot to ask players if they prefer toxicity or not, no study has likely occurred as it lacks any merit. There is a reason game companies spend time creating a punishment system for toxic players and it's because people find it ruins their enjoyment.

If you're looking for definitive statistics to back up a common sense claim, you won't find them here. I neither have access to the tools required to conduct such a study nor do I have the time required to do so.
